question: How are Workflows moved between instances?
options: Workflows are moved using Update Sets
Workflows are moved using Transform Maps
Workflows are moved using Application Sets
Workflows cannot be moved between instances
correctAnswers: Workflows are moved using Update Sets

question: Which statement is true about business rules?
options: A business rule must run before a database action occurs
A business rule can be a piece of Javascript
A business rule must not run before a database action occurs
A business rule monitors fields on a form
correctAnswers: A business rule can be a piece of Javascript

question: Which of the following allows a user to edit field values in a list without opening the form?
What is a formatter?
options: A formatter allows you to configure applications on your instance
A formatter is a form element used to display information that is not a field in the record
A formatter allows you to populate fields automatically
A formatter is a set of conditions applied to a table to help find and work with data
correctAnswers: A formatter is a form element used to display information that is not a field in the record

question: Which one of the following statements applies to a set of fields when they are coalesced during an import?
options: If a match is found using the coalesce fields, the existing record is updated with the information being imported
If a match is not found using the coalesce fields, the system does not create a Transform Map
If a match is found using the coalesce fields, the system creates a new record
If a match is not found using the coalesce fields, the existing record is updated
correctAnswers: If a match is found using the coalesce fields, the existing record is updated with the information being imported

question: Which ServiceNow products can be used to discover and populate the CMDB?
Which are valid ServiceNow User Authentication Methods?
Which concepts are associated with the ServiceNow CMDB?
Which tool is used to have conversations with logged-in users in real-time?
What is generated from the Service Catalog once a user places an order?
What is the purpose of a Related List?
options: To dot-walk to a core table

question: What is a Record Producer?
options: A type of Catalog Item used for Requests, not Services
A type of Catalog Item that provides easy ordering by bundling requests
A type of Catalog Item that allows users to create task-based records from the Service Catalog
correctAnswers: A type of Catalog Item that allows users to create task-based records from the Service Catalog

question: What is the Import Set Table?
options: A table where data will be placed, post-transformation
A staging area for imported records
A repository for Update Set information
correctAnswers: A staging area for imported records

question: What is a Dictionary Override?
options: Incoming customer update in an Update Set for same objects
Addition, modification, or removal affecting IT services
A task in a flow requesting an action
Sets field properties in extended tables
correctAnswers: Sets field properties in extended tables

question: Which term refers to application menus and modules you may want to access quickly?
Which group of permissions is used to control Application and Module access?
Which three Variable Types can be added to a Service Catalog Item?
options: Number List, Single Line Text, and Reference
Multiple Choice, Select Box, and Checkbox
correctAnswers: Multiple Choice, Select Box, and Checkbox

question: A Service Catalog may include which of the following components?
options: Order Guides, Catalog Items, and Interceptors
Catalog Items, Asset Contracts, Task Surveys
Record Producers, Order Guides, and Catalog Items

question: What is the name of the conversational bot platform that provides assistance?
Which of the following can be customized through the Basic Configuration UI 16 module?
What information does the System Dictionary contain?
options: The human-readable labels and language settings
The definition for each table and column
The information on how tables relate to each other
The language dictionary used for spell checking
correctAnswers: The definition for each table and column

question: Buttons, form links, and context menu items are all examples of what type of functionality?
A REQ number in the Service Catalog represents:
options: the individual item in the order

question: Which one of the following statements best describes the purpose of an Update Set?
options: An Update Set allows administrators to group a series of changes into a named set and then move this set as a unit to other systems
By default, an Update Set includes customizations, Business Rules, and homepages
An Update Set is a group of customizations that is moved from Production to Development
By default, the changes included in an Update Set are visible only in the instance to which they are applied
correctAnswers: An Update Set allows administrators to group a series of changes into a named set and then move this set as a unit to other systems

question: What is the platform name for the User table?
In what order should filter elements be specified?
Which of the following is used to initiate a flow?
Which one of the following statements is true about Column Context Menus?
options: It displays actions such as creating quick reports, configuring the list, and exporting data
It displays actions related to filtering options, assigning tags, and search
It displays actions related to viewing and filtering the entire list
It displays actions such as view form, view related task, and add relationship
correctAnswers: It displays actions such as creating quick reports, configuring the list, and exporting data

question: Which one of the following statements is a recommendation from ServiceNow about Update Sets?
options: Avoid using the Default Update set as an Update Set for moving customizations from instance to instance
Before moving customizations from instance to instance with Update Sets, ensure that both instances are different versions
Use the Baseline Update Set to store the contents of items after they are changed the first time
Once an Update Set is closed as In Progress change it back to Complete until it is applied to another instance
correctAnswers: Avoid using the Default Update set as an Update Set for moving customizations from instance to instance

question: What is a characteristic about Service Catalog variables?
options: Service Catalog variables can only be used in Record Producers
Service Catalog variables can only be used in Order Guides
Service Catalog variables cannot affect the order price
Service Catalog variables are global by default
correctAnswers: Service Catalog variables are global by default

question: Access Control rules may be defined with which of the following permission requirements?
When searching using the App Navigator, what can be returned?
What is a schema map?
options: Enables defining records as trouble sources for CIs
Graphically organizes visual task boards for the CMDB
Graphically displays the CIs that support a business service
Displays details of tables and their relationships visually
correctAnswers: Displays details of tables and their relationships visually

question: The display sequence is controlled in a Service Catalog Item using which field?
options: The Default Value field in the Catalog Item form
The Sequence field in the Catalog Item form
The Order field in the Variable form
The Choice field in the Variable form
correctAnswers: The Order field in the Variable form

question: What is the difference between Insert and Update operations on a form?
options: Insert creates a new record and Update saves changes, both remain on the form
Insert creates a new record and Update saves changes, both exit the form
Insert saves changes and exits the form, Update saves changes and remains on the form
Insert saves changes and remains on the form, Update saves changes and exits the form
correctAnswers: Insert saves changes and exits the form, Update saves changes and remains on the form

question: Which statement is true when a new table is created by extending another table?
options: The new table archives the parent table and assumed its roles in the database
The new table inherits all of the Business Rules, Client Scripts, and UI Policies of the parent table, but none of the existing fields
The new table inherits all of the fields of the parent table and can also contain new fields unique to itself
The new table inherits all of the fields, but does not inherit Access Control rules, Client Scripts, and UI Policies of the parent table
correctAnswers: The new table inherits all of the fields of the parent table and can also contain new fields unique to itself

question: What is the function of user impersonation?
As it relates to ServiceNow reporting, what is a metric?
options: A metric is a report gauge used on homepages to display real-time data
A metric is a time measurement used to report the effectiveness of workflows and SLAs
A metric is used to measure and evaluate the effectiveness of IT service management processes
A metric is a comparative measurement used to report the effectiveness of flows and SLAs
correctAnswers: A metric is used to measure and evaluate the effectiveness of IT service management processes

question: Which statement describes the purpose of an Order Guide?
options: Order Guides restrict the number of items in an order to only one item per request
Order Guide provide a list of guidelines for Administrators on how to set up item variables
Order Guide provide the ability to order multiple, related items as one request
Order Guides take the user directly to the checkout without prompting for information
correctAnswers: Order Guide provide the ability to order multiple, related items as one request

question: Which types of client scripts are supported in ServiceNow?
Table Access Control rules are processed in which order?
options: any table name (wildcard), parent table name, table name
table name, parent table name, any table name (wildcard)
parent table name, table name, any table name (wildcard)
any table name (wildcard), table name, parent table name
correctAnswers: table name, parent table name, any table name (wildcard)

question: Which technique is used to get information from a series of referenced fields from different tables?
Which one of the following statements describes the contents of the Configuration Management Database (CMDB)?
options: The CMDB contains data about tangible and intangible business assets
The CMDB contains the Business Rules that direct the intangible, configurable assets used by a company
The CMDB archives all Service Management PaaS equipment metadata and usage statistics
The CMDB contains ITIL process data pertaining to configuration items
correctAnswers: The CMDB contains data about tangible and intangible business assets

question: Where can Admins check which release is running on a ServiceNow instance?
When using the Load Data and Transform Map process, what is the Mapping Assist used for?
options: Mapping fields using the Import Log
Mapping fields using a Field Map
correctAnswers: Mapping fields using a Field Map

question: How is the Event Log different from the Event Registry?
options: Event Log contains generated Events, the Event Registry is a table of Event definitions
Event Log is formatted in the Log style, the Event Registry displays different fields
Event Log lists Events that were triggered by integrations, the Event Registry lists the Events triggered during the day
Event Log is the same as the Event Registry
correctAnswers: Event Log contains generated Events, the Event Registry is a table of Event definitions

question: What is the path an Administrator could take to view the fulfillment stage task list for an order placed by a user?
Which would NOT appear in the History section of the Application Navigator?
Which of the following is true of Service Catalog Items in relation to the Service Catalog?
From the User menu, which actions can a user select?
What module in the Service Catalog application does an Administrator access to begin creating a new item?
A knowledge article must be which of the following states to display to a user?
Which term best describes something that is created, has work performed upon it, and is eventually moved to a state of closed?
Knowledge Base Search results can be sorted by which of the following?
What allows agents to initiate a group discussion from a Workspace task-based or interaction-based record?
What tool allows you to drag and drop to specify links between source fields on an import set table and destination fields on any ServiceNow table?
By default, a report is shared with the following:
options: Only groups that the report creator belongs to

question: On a business rule, which setting determines at what points the rule executes? What are the options for specifying that timing?
What is created by default when you create a new table? (Select 2 Answers)
options: Application Menu with the same name as the table label
Module with the plural of the table label
Dashboard to manage the table's activity
correctAnswers: Application Menu with the same name as the table label
Module with the plural of the table label

question: Which of the following are the UI Actions in a form? (Select 3 Answers)
options: Form context menu items (right-click the header)
Form links (related links in a form)
correctAnswers: Form context menu items (right-click the header)
Form links (related links in a form)

question: What are examples of UI actions relating to lists? (Choose 4 Answers)
What are the different Schema relationship types that are supported for tables? (Select 4 Answers)
Which of the following is a true statement regarding Flow Designer actions? (Select 3 Answers)
options: Define when the flow is performed
Can be contained in a spoke
Represent reusable operations for use across multiple flows
Provide the ability to build your custom actions
correctAnswers: Can be contained in a spoke
Represent reusable operations for use across multiple flows
Provide the ability to build your custom actions

question: What is a Configuration Item (CI)?
options: Components of an infrastructure required to deliver a product or service
A database used to store configuration records throughout their lifecycle
Information that further describes a CI such as name, serial number, or operating system
A set of tools and databases that are used to manage an organization's configuration data
correctAnswers: Components of an infrastructure required to deliver a product or service

question: What are the three types of Flow Designer triggers? (Select 3 Answers)
Which CMDB feature tracks the activities and history of data sources as they insert and update CI attributes? (Select 2 Answers)
If a knowledge base has no access details specified, what users are able to read articles in that knowledge base?
options: Any user with an articles permalink

question: What access control rules are created by default when creating a custom table? (Select 4 Answers)
Who can add or remove widgets in a dashboard? (Select 3 Answers)
options: Users with edit access to the dashboard
Users with view access to the dashboard
correctAnswers: Users with edit access to the dashboard

question: Which group of permissions is used to control Application and Module access?
Which tool graphically displays an infrastructure view for a configuration item and its relationship with other CIs?
When a Flow runs an action, it generates a runtime value that stays the same for the duration of the flow. What is the name of that runtime value?
Which field should you look at if you want a unique identifier record of 32 characters?
When testing a catalog item having a manager approval flow, which best practices would you follow? (Choose 3 Answers)
options: Make sure the latest flows are activated.
Use the instance incognito setting to quickly toggle between requester and approver
Impersonate the requester to ensure the form works
Make sure the requester's user record has a manager specified.
Create and select your testing Update set, before starting the test cases.
Use your admin account, so you can approve the items quickly
correctAnswers: Make sure the latest flows are activated.
Make sure the requester's user record has a manager specified.
Create and select your testing Update set, before starting the test cases.

question: A Product Owner cannot see tasks on ‘Service Desk > My Group Work List’. What could be the root cause?
options: Product Owner is not a member of Development group
Product Owner has no assignment group
Product owner is accessing ServiceNow using incorrect credentials
Product Owner does not have itil role
correctAnswers: Product Owner does not have itil role

question: Which tab contains the Activity Stream for a task?
Which ServiceNow resource can be used as a blueprint to map your IT services to ServiceNow?
As a System Admin, how can you protect an application by identifying and restricting access to application files and data?
What are the steps for applying an update set to an instance? (Select 3 Answers)
Which tab on the Knowledge Base record would you use to identify the set of users who can read articles?
The CMDB is the authoritative source of what information? (Select 3 Answers)
options: Contents of all server and application configuration files

question: An Incident Manager cannot see tasks in the ‘Service Desk > My Group Work’ list. What could explain this? (Select 2 Answers)
options: The incident manager does not have the ITIL or service_fulfiller role
The incident manager is not listed as the assignment group manager
The incident manager is not part of the service desk group
No incident task is assigned to any of the group members
The incident manager is not a member of the critical incidents group
correctAnswers: The incident manager does not have the ITIL or service_fulfiller role
The incident manager is not a member of the critical incidents group

question: You can use the Data Management plugins to define table relationships or minimize performance issues. What are these plugins? (Select 3 Answers)
When implementing ITSM, where would you navigate to update the Now Platform UI branding including company logo and colors? (Select 2 Answers)
When importing data, what happens to imported rows if no coalesce field is specified?
options: All rows are treated as new records, but error will be flagged in the import log
Duplicate rows are rejected from the import
All rows are treated as new records. No existing records were updated
All rows are rejected from the import, as coalesce field is required
correctAnswers: All rows are treated as new records. No existing records were updated

question: Access controls are evaluated in this order. Within step one, what order are the table ACLs evaluated?
options: General to specific: table ACL, table.Field ACL, parent table.Field ACL
Specific to general: table.Field ACL, parent table.Field ACL, * Field ACL
Top to bottom: wildcard table ACL, parent table ACL, table ACL
Specific to general: table ACL, parent table ACL, wildcard(*)ACL
correctAnswers: Specific to general: table ACL, parent table ACL, wildcard(*)ACL

question: What Visual Task Board type automatically updates the tasks when the respective cards are edited or change lanes?

options: A record that defines where to get the data to import
The conversion of data from an import set table to another table
Update existing target table records when transforming import data

question: What allows you to see more information on the same screen while using Visual Task Boards (VTB)?

Which of the following are captured in an Update Set?
Where do you navigate to see the notifications currently defined on the Now Platform?

options: Business rule could be Python script
Business rule should run after a database action
Business rule depends on form actions

question: The display sequence is controlled in a Service Catalog Item using which of the following?
options: The Default value field in the Catalog item form
The Sequence field in the Catalog Item form
The Order field in the Variable form
The Choice field in the variable form
correctAnswers: The Order field in the Variable form

question: Which of the following statements is true about the admin role? (Select 3 Answers)
options: Non-admin users cannot add users to a group containing the admin role
A user with only the user_admin role can grant the admin role to other users
To grant the admin role to a user, the granting user must also have the admin role
A user with only the admin role cannot grant the security_admin role to other users
A non-admin user with only the security_Admin role can add user to a group that contains the security_Admin role
correctAnswers: Non-admin users cannot add users to a group containing the admin role
To grant the admin role to a user, the granting user must also have the admin role
A user with only the admin role cannot grant the security_admin role to other users

question: What catalog tool would you use to create a catalog item or record producer?
To quickly return to your instance home page, what item would you click?
What function do you use to add buttons, links, and context menu items on forms and lists?
Group records are stored in which table?
Which database provides a logical model of your company infrastructure by identifying, controlling, maintaining and verifying CIs that exist?
Your customer requires that they be able to monitor which users are performing impersonations in their instance. What would you do to meet that requirement?
options: Add the role Log Write [sn log write] to the Impersonator Group
Create user update set for impersonation tracking
From User icon, select Elevate Roles
On the Impersonator role record, right click and select Create Log

question: What are benefits of assigning work tasks to a group, rather than to an individual? (Choose four.)
options: Group members can choose their tasks from My Groups Work
Groups can assign tasks to users based on on-call schedules
Site support members can pick tasks, based on Location
Groups can assign tasks to users based on skills
Group members can avoid tasks, which are nearing SLA breach
Groups can assign tasks to users based on availability
correctAnswers: Group members can choose their tasks from My Groups Work
Groups can assign tasks to users based on on-call schedules
Groups can assign tasks to users based on skills
Groups can assign tasks to users based on availability

question: What controls the publishing and retiring process for knowledge articles?
Categories in the knowledge base, by default, can be created and edited by which knowledge workers? (Choose two.)
What are the components that make up a filter condition? (Choose three.)
What is a key difference between Reporting and Performance Analytics?
options: Performance Analytics contains snapshots of data taken over time; Reporting shows only the data as it is, at the moment the report is run.
Performance Analytics can show trends; Reports cannot.
Reports can be run on a scheduled basis; Performance Analytics cannot.
Performance Analytics data can be published to Dashboards; Reports cannot.
Performance Analytics shows KPIs; Reporting does not.
correctAnswers: Performance Analytics contains snapshots of data taken over time; Reporting shows only the data as it is, at the moment the report is run.

question: When a user reports that they are not able to see modules on the application navigator, what can you do, to see what modules are visible to them?
options: Look up their password, so you can login with their account

question: Which statement correctly describes the differences between a Client Script and a Business Rule?
options: A Client Script executes before a record is loaded and a Business Rule executes after a record is loaded
A Client Script executes on the server and a Business Rule executes on the client
A Client Script executes on the client and a Business Rule executes on the server
A Client Script executes before a record is loaded and a Business Rule executes after a record is updated
correctAnswers: A Client Script executes on the client and a Business Rule executes on the server

What is the most common role that has access to almost all platform features, functions, and data?
When impersonating a user for testing purposes, what is the best way to return the instance, logged in with your user account?
options: Turn your computer off and on again

question: When importing data, what happens to imported rows if no coalesce field is specified?
options: All rows are rejected from the import, as coalesce field is required.
All rows are treated as new records. No existing records are updated.
Duplicate rows are rejected from the import.
All rows are treated as new records, but errors will be flagged in the import log.
correctAnswers: All rows are treated as new records. No existing records are updated.

options: A set of user access policies
A set of access control rules

question: You are asked to create an option in the Service Catalog which will allow a user to click Get Help and describe the issue they are having. These forms should create incident records, which are automatically routed to the Service Desk. Which method would you use?

What type of query allows you to filter list data using normal words, instead of the condition builder?
Which field (or fields) is used as a unique key during imports?
On the Reports page, what sections allow you to see which reports are visible to different audiences? (Choose four.)
What would you do, on a list, if you wanted to show the records in groups, based on the column category? (Choose two.)
options: On list Context Menu, select Group By > Category
On the Filter Menu, select Group By > Category
Click Group On icon, select Category
On Navigator Filter, type tablename.group.category and press enter
On the Category column title, click Context menu > Group By Category
correctAnswers: On list Context Menu, select Group By > Category

What attributes can you manage, using System Properties > Basic Configuration UI16? (Choose five.)
On the knowledge base record, which tab would you use to define which users are not able to write articles to the knowledge base?

options: Scheduled Reports, a custom snapshot table, and a Trend report
Scheduled Reports, a custom snapshot table, and a Projection report

question: On a filter condition, which component is always a choice list?

options: Create New module has a broken link
User should be using Chrome instead of Explorer for their browser
User has read role, but not the write role on the Inventory table
correctAnswers: User has read role, but not the write role on the Inventory table

options: Right click on header > Add > Field
Right click on header > Configure > UX Dashboard

question: Which tool is used to define relationships between fields in an import set table and a target table?
Tables may have a One to Many relationship. From the Service Catalog, what are examples of tables having a one to many relationship? (Choose three.)
options: One Approval can have many Requests
One Request can have many Requested Items
One Requested Item can have many Approvals
One Requested Item can have many Catalog Tasks
One Cart can have many Requests
correctAnswers: One Request can have many Requested Items

question: What component causes a flow to run after a record has been created or updated?

options: Common Service Data Model (CSDM) product view
correctAnswers: Common Service Data Model (CSDM) product view

question: Which features allow you to update multiple records at one time? (Choose two.)

The wait time for end users is based on the round-trip between the client and the server. What activities are included in the round-trips?
On a Business Rule, the When setting determines at what point the rule executes. What are the options for specifying that timing?
What is the result of the order in which access controls are evaluated?
options: Ensures user has access to the fields in a table, before considering their access to the table
Ensures user can get to work as quickly as possible
Ensures user has access to the application, before evaluating access to a module within the application
Ensures user has access to a table, before evaluating access to a field in the table
correctAnswers: Ensures user has access to a table, before evaluating access to a field in the table

question: What are different types of Data Sources, which may be imported into ServiceNow? (Choose four.)
When designing a flow, how do you reference data from a record, in that flow?
options: Drag the table icon onto the flow definition
Use the condition builder to specify the desired values
Specify the source table on the data pill related list
Drag the data pill onto the flow definition
Add the table reference using the slush bucket
correctAnswers: Drag the data pill onto the flow definition
